keyPoints: 15+ rapid-fire definitions collected via speed round
Sufficiency cluster: 'having what you need when you need it'
Generosity cluster: 'more than enough', 'overflow'
Systems/regenerative cluster: 'self-renewing', 'flourishing'
Psychological/spiritual cluster: 'state of mind', 'lack of fear'
Relational cluster: 'being valued by others'
Tension: objective condition vs subjective experience vs systemic quality

Abundance Spectrum.watchFor: Which abundance definitions show up in practice? Applied how?

emergingPatterns: Core group can hold both heavy trauma processing and lighter topical discussions
Personal stories (Kevin) illustrate theoretical discussions (Call 01 grief)
Systems-level thinking across multiple domains (Mike Nelson, Klaus Mager pattern)
Trust is central: personal trust (Call 01), information trust (Call 03), reality trust (Call 04)
Historical trauma connects to current conflicts (WWII → Gaza)
Definition obsession: group returns repeatedly to definitional questions (sense-making, collaboration, abundance, OGM itself)
Meta-comfortable: group comfortable turning lens on itself (Calls 05, 09)
Process over outcomes: tension continues but increasing acceptance of salon culture
Cognitive diversity as asset: explicitly valued over consensus (Alex in Call 09)
Theory vs practice gap: discuss collaboration (Call 07) but struggle to implement infrastructure (Call 09)
Intimacy preference: small group, deep connections over scale (Jerry: one Zoom screen max)
Platform frustration recurring: no good answers for community tools (Call 09)
Federal government failure theme growing: Kevin, Rob, Klaus all frustrated with federal institutions (Calls 04, 06)
questionsToTrack: How do societies process grief well vs. poorly?
What replaces journalism as it dies?
How do we coordinate fragmented community initiatives?
Why is there a business model for spreading disinformation but not for fighting it?
How do institutions protect perpetrators?
What happens to communities when federal disaster support fails?
How do we know what's real when AI generates convincing fakes? (Call 04)
Can we have shared facts without shared narratives? (Call 04)
How do democracies tolerate obvious corruption? (Call 04)
What do we mean by 'sense' and 'sense-making'? (Call 05)
Should sense-making have a goal or is exploration the point? (Call 05)
How do we balance goals/deadlines with open exploration? (Call 05)
What are 'third places' and how do they enable community coordination? (Call 06)
How long does it take low-status neighborhoods to recover from disasters? (Call 06: New Orleans 20 years)
Can AI help coordinate splintered movements without massive databases? (Call 06: Klaus's vision)
Can you have collaboration without identical shared vision? (Call 07)
When is extended definitional dialogue valuable vs frustrating? (Calls 05, 07, 08)
Is abundance objective condition, subjective experience, or systemic quality? (Call 08)
Do we want to grow? If so, in what ways? (Call 09: central OGM question)
Is OGM a salon or should it create bodies of work? (Call 09)
How do we enable 'who's doing what with whom' discovery without violating privacy? (Call 09: Pete's paradox)
What tool should new communities use? Why hasn't software solved this? (Call 09: Jerry's frustration)
Can likes/comments work at small scale without statistical throughput? (Call 09)
